dublin_core.dcvalue: The Hang-Up and Track campaign used smartphones to record household registration data during installation of long-lasting insecticidal nets to prevent malaria in eight health zones in Kasai-Occidental province.
CHW, Public sector health system (national, regional, district)

Crystal Stafford, Project Coordinator, IMA World Health, Email: crystalstafford@imaworldhealth.org; Charlotte Ndolerire, Project Coordinator, IMA World Health, Email: CharlotteNdolerire@imaworldhealth.org; Andrew Chou, Consultant â€“ Mobile Technology, IMA World Health, Email: yuheng.andrew.chou@gmail.com
8 Health Zones in the western part of the province of Kasai-Occidental, Democratic Republic of Congo: Kitangwa, Mutena, Kamonia, Kamuesha, Banga Lubaka, Kanzala, Tshikapa, and Kalonda
Data collection and reporting, Registries and vital events tracking, Child health, Infectious diseases, Malaria and other vector-borne diseases, Maternal health, Newborn health, Parasitic diseases
